name: indelicacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact that words or actions are not suitable for a situation and are likely to be offensive, or words or actions that are like this: He had acted with great indelicacy. To mention their financial problems would have been an indelicacy. See
indelicate
More examplesFewer examplesA few commentators had the indelicacy to note the minister’s lack of military experience. He can be frank to the point of indelicacy.There were a few indelicacies in the writing.
